field.label: Enable
field.help: This will activate the onion router.

field.label: Listen Interfaces
field.help: Add more than localhost IP addresses to listen IPs for SOCKS connections.

field.label: SOCKS Port Number
field.help: Port number on which the SOCKS server should listen. The default is 9050. You should not change this unless you need the port.

field.label: Control Port
field.help: Control Port number on which tor should listen. The default is 9051. You should not change this unless you need the port.

field.label: Dormant Canceled By Startup
field.help: If you check this box may help if tor is stuck at startup.

field.label: Create a logfile
field.help: If you check this, a log file will be written to disk.

field.label: Logfile level
field.help: This is the detail level of the log. A higher level means more data is logged.

field.label: Send log messages to syslog
field.help: Syslog is a service which is made to collect log messages from different software and maybe to a central logging server. Check this box if you have such a setup.

field.label: Syslog level
field.help: This is the detail level of the log. A higher level means more data is logged.

field.label: Fascist Firewall Ports
field.help: Open ports by the fascist firewall.

field.label: Enable Transparent Proxy
field.help: Enable this, if you want to anonymize traffic originating from a network.

field.label: Transparent Port
field.help: Port number on which the transparent proxy server should listen. The default is 9040. You should not change this unless you need the port.

field.label: Transparent DNS Port
field.help: Port number on which the transparent DNS server should listen. The default is 9053. You should not change this unless you need the port.

field.label: Transparent IP Pool
field.help: Enter a network which will be used as an IP Pool to map onion Hosts.

field.label: Map Host To IP Pool
field.help: Enable this, if you want to map onion services to the IP pool configured above.

field.label: Maximum Memory In Queues (MB)
field.help: If this amount of memory is reached, Tor will close circuits until 10% of this limit are free again.
